thread.title: Comment on Bowl Prediction Watch 2016 by cats paw
thread.title_full: Comment on Bowl Prediction Watch 2016 by cats paw

author: cats paw
title: Comment on Bowl Prediction Watch 2016 by cats paw
text:
Posted in Main | 2 Responses 
Yes, Thursday night sucked. But, we’re still on Bowl Watch 2016 thanks to an impressive 4-2 start to the 2015-16 season for Kentucky football. So, where do people project the Wildcats to be playing in the postseason? 
CBS Sports has Kentucky playing against Cincinnati in the Birmingham Bowl. It’s a rematch from the Round of 32 in the 2015 NCAA Tournament, but no word if the dude Willie Cauley-Stein dunked on will be able to watch this game. Completely off tracks here, but UC vs UK is a football game that needs to happen each year, especially with the capability to play at Paul Brown Stadium every other year. 
ESPN has the Wildcats playing in the Music City Bowl. Look, we all love Nashville, so let’s chalk this one up as a win. 
Saturday Down South has the battle of Wildcats as Kentucky will be taking on Kansas State in the Liberty Bowl. 
Obviously any bowl game would be considered a successful season for Kentucky, but out of these three which one does BBN prefer? Article written by Bobby Reagan One time representative of UK at SEC 3v3 basketball championships. Northern Yankee living the Kentucky dream. Follow me @uklefty22 2 responses to “Bowl Prediction Watch 2016” Janssen October 18, 2015 at 8:09 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Still hoping for the Outback bowl. Looks like we’ll need to finish 2nd in the East to pull it off. cats paw October 18, 2015 at 8:20 pm | Permalink | Reply 
My Cards will be lucky to make a bowl this year… oh well, still glad I have Petrino. Class guy. Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
